p: Mild adverse events (nausea, diarrhea, constipation, abdominal pains causing awakening, taste disturbance, dry mouth, bitterness and unpleasant changes in the mouth taste, headache, skin redness, dizziness, and itching) and severe adverse events (gastrointestinal bleeding and severe allergic reactions) were also recorded to assess the safety of treatment regimens. Treatment was discontinued if severe adverse events occurred. In order to evaluate the safety, the laboratory tests (serum alanine aminotransferases and aspartate aminotransferases, alkaline phosphatase, total and direct bilirubin, random blood sugar, blood urea nitrogen, and creatinine) were performed at the start and after treatment. Patients were asked to keep their medication until the end of the study. To consumption, more than 80%, 60-80%, and less than 60% of prescribed medications were considered full, good, and poor compliance rates, respectively [ 24, 33].
